org.sensorhub.impl.sensor.swe

Class SWEVirtualSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sensorhub.impl.module.AbstractModule<ConfigType>
      • org.sensorhub.impl.sensor.AbstractSensorModule<SWEVirtualSensorConfig>
        • org.sensorhub.impl.sensor.swe.SWEVirtualSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventProducer, IDataProducerModule<SWEVirtualSensorConfig>, IModuleWithDescription, IModule<SWEVirtualSensorConfig>, ISensorModule<SWEVirtualSensorConfig>

    public class SWEVirtualSensor
extends AbstractSensorModule<SWEVirtualSensorConfig>

    Driver for SWE enabled sensors communicating via SOS & SPS standard services. This can also be used to communicate with a sensor deployed on another (usually remote) sensor hub node. TODO forward full SensorML description

    Since:
    Sep 5, 2015
    Author:
    Alex Robin

      boolean isConnected()
      Returns the sensor connection status.

      void start()
      Starts the module with the current configuration.
      init() should always be called before start().
      void stop()
      Stops the module.
      All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
      stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws SensorHubException
        Description copied from interface: IModule
        Stops the module.
        All temporary resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called (ex: memory, files, connections, etc.)
        stop() can be called right after init() even if start() hasn't been called.
        Throws:
        SensorHubException

      • getCurrentFeatureOfInterest

        public AbstractFeature getCurrentFeatureOfInterest()
        Description copied from interface: IDataProducerModule
        Retrieves the feature of interest for which this producer is currently generating data.

        In the case of a module generating data from multiple entities (e.g. sensor network), the feature of interest currently observed by a given entity can be retrieved using IMultiSourceDataProducer.getCurrentFeatureOfInterest(String)
        Specified by:
        getCurrentFeatureOfInterest in interface IDataProducerModule<SWEVirtualSensorConfig>
        Overrides:
        getCurrentFeatureOfInterest in class AbstractSensorModule<SWEVirtualSensorConfig>
        Returns:
        map of entityID to feature objects

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
             throws SensorHubException
        Description copied from interface: IModule
        Cleans up all ressources used by the module when deleted All persistent resources created by the module should be cleaned when this is called
        Throws:

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Description copied from interface: ISensorModule
        Returns the sensor connection status.
        This method must do whatever it can to really detect the presence of the sensor. Consequently, the method can take a long time to complete and must not be called repeatedly.
        Returns:
        true if sensor is actually connected and can communicate with the driver
